articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes in the southern Gaza Strip city of Khan Younis killed at least 38 people since Thursday night and Israeli forces launched a night-time raid on a hospital in the north, Palestinian officials said.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill 38 people in Khan Younis, storm north Gaza hospital, say medics

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, James Mackenzie, John Irish
articles.description: The Paris conference aims to mobilise both humanitarian aid and support for the Lebanese military.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese troops as France rallies support for army

articles.author: Julia Payne, John O'Donnell
articles.description: The possible steps include "catch-all" clauses to identify and stop suspect goods shipments destined for Russia and wider oil shipping curbs, sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Europe seeks to underpin Russia sanctions, fearing Trump overhaul

articles.author: James Redmayne, Alasdair Pal
articles.description: The demand for Britain to pay reparations or make other amends for transatlantic slavery is a long-standing one, but has recently gained momentum, particularly among the Caribbean Community and the African Union.
articles.title: King Charles acknowledges Commonwealth's 'painful' history with slavery on summit agenda

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said his Turkish counterpart, Tayyip Erdogan, had proposed reviving contacts on Black Sea shipping but that he had not yet had time to study the documents.
articles.title: Putin to look at Black Sea shipping proposals from Turkey's Erdogan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that it was Russia's business whether or not it decided to use North Korean troops and said that if Ukraine wanted to join NATO then Moscow could do what it wanted to ensure its own security.
articles.title: Putin says it is our affair if Russia uses North Korean troops

articles.author: Ashley Tang, Rozanna Latiff
articles.description: Malaysia's proposal to introduce laws allowing house arrest for some offences seeks to reduce recidivism rates and prison overcrowding, and is not aimed at getting former premier Najib Razak out of jail, a minister said on Friday.
articles.title: Malaysia denies new laws on house arrest are geared towards jailed ex-PM Najib

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A deal allowing South Korean K2 tanks to be produced in Poland could be signed in coming weeks, Polish president Andrzej Duda said on Friday, a potential boost for Warsaw's plans to build up its defences.
articles.title: Warsaw and Seoul close to deal on producing K2 tanks in Poland, Duda says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian prosecutors said on Friday they had launched an investigation into North Korea's support for Russia in the war as a possible crime of aggression.
articles.title: Ukraine investigating North Korea's support for Russia as possible crime of aggression

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Friday there was a real sense of urgency in getting to a diplomatic resolution to end the conflict in Lebanon between Israel and Iran-aligned Hezbollah, while calling for the protection of civilians.
articles.title: Blinken says urgent to reach diplomatic resolution in Lebanon
